About Me

Hi Everyone, I am Imran Khan and I am from Bangladesh. Currently, I am a Ph.D. student in Computer Engineering at Northeastern University. Before that, I completed my master’s in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at Southern Illinois University Carbondale (2020) and I earned my Bachelor of Science in Electrical and Electronic Engineering from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET) in 2014. Currently, I am working as a Research Assistant in NUWiNS Lab under the supervision of Dr. Dimitrios Koutsonikolas. My research interest lies in the area of 5G mm-Wave Networking.

Experience

AT&T Labs, Inc.

Research Intern

June 2020 - August 2020

https://about.att.com/sites/labs

Investigated performnce of low-latency video streaming over cellular networks in a joint project with Facebook. The purpose of this study was to correlate RAN side KPIs with application layer metrics to enhance user Quality of Experience (QoE).

Education

Northeastern University

Ph.D. in Computer Engineering

2020 - Present

I am part of NuWINS lab and also affiliated with the Northeastern Institure for the Wireless Internet of Things (WIoT). As part of the WIoT I am involved in developing next generation cellular networks/testbeds. Besides, my other projects involve ensuring end to end performance, mobility, reliability and consistency of performance of mmWave cellular in current 5G.

Southern Illinois University Carbondale

Master's in Computer Engineering

2018 - 2020

I was part of the Ubiquitous Networking & Computing lab where I was involved with investigating Multi-Path TCP (MPTCP) performance in heterogenous networks.

Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET)

B.Sc. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering

2009 - 2014

Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET) is one of the top enginnering schools in Bangladesh.
